message.content:
cs.DM, cs.DS, cs.CG, cs.NA, cs.GT

Reasoning: 
- cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics): The paper deals with a classic NP-complete problem and introduces new concepts related to cycles in graphs, which are typical topics in discrete mathematics.
- cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms): The paper proposes algorithms and heuristics to solve the feedback arc (vertex) set problem, which is a fundamental problem in graph theory and algorithm design.
- cs.CG (Computational Geometry): The paper discusses the computation of subgraphs of cycles in graphs, which can be seen as a geometric problem in the context of graph drawing and visualization.
- cs.NA (Numerical Analysis): The paper presents dynamic programming techniques to solve weighted versions of the feedback arc (vertex) set problem, which involve numerical computations and optimization.
- cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory): The paper studies the complexity and approximability of the feedback arc (vertex) set problem, which is a relevant problem in game theory and social choice theory.
